recipes.name: Udon Noodle Stir Fry
recipes.method:
1. Cook udon noodles according to package instructions. 
2. In a wok or large pan, heat sesame oil over high heat. 
3. Add sliced beef and cook until browned. 
4. Add onion, garlic, and bell peppers and stir fry for 2-3 minutes. 
5. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, salt, and pepper. 
6. Add cooked udon noodles and stir fry for another 2-3 minutes. 
7. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Salmon
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, ginger, and garlic. 
2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 
3. Add salmon fillets and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side. 
4. Pour the teriyaki sauce over the salmon and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until the sauce thickens and the salmon is cooked through. 
5. Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables.

recipes.name: Beef Sukiyaki
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. 
2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 
3. Add beef and cook for 2-3 minutes, until browned. 
4. Add onion, scallions, and shiitake mushrooms and cook for another 2-3 minutes. 
5. Add the soy sauce mixture and water and bring to a boil. 
6. Reduce heat to low and add tofu and spinach. 
7. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened. 
8. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Matcha Cheesecake
recipes.method:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F. 
2. In a bowl, mix together graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. 
3. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. 
4. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth. 
5. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. 
6. Stir in sour cream, matcha powder, and vanilla extract. 
7. Pour the mixture over the crust. 
8. Bake for 45-50 minutes, until the cheesecake is set but still slightly jiggly in the center. 
9. Let cool to room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.name: Shrimp Tempura Udon
recipes.method:
1. In a pot, bring dashi stock to a boil. 
2. Reduce heat to low and add soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, ginger, and garlic. 
3. Cook udon noodles according to package instructions. 
4. In a bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. 
5. Add ice-cold water and whisk until smooth. 
6. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F. 
7. Dip shrimp in batter and fry in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. 
8. Drain on paper towels. 
9. Divide cooked udon noodles among four bowls. 
10. Pour the hot broth over the noodles and top with shrimp tempura. 
11. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Miso Soup
ingredients: 1 sheet nori, cut into small pieces
recipes.method:
1. In a pot, bring dashi stock to a boil. 
2. Reduce heat to low and add miso paste, stirring until dissolved. 
3. Add tofu and cook for 2-3 minutes. 
4. Add green onions and nori and cook for another minute. 
5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Tempura Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
recipes.method:
1. In a bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. 
2. Add ice-cold water and whisk until smooth. 
3. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F. 
4. Dip shrimp in batter and fry in batches until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. 
5. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Matcha Latte
recipes.method:
1. In a bowl, whisk together matcha powder and hot water until smooth. 
2. In a small pot, heat milk and honey over medium heat until hot but not boiling. 
3. Pour milk mixture into the bowl with matcha and whisk until frothy. 
4. Pour into a mug and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Teriyaki
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, brown sugar, ginger, and garlic. 
2. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 
3. Add chicken breasts and cook for 5-6 minutes on each side, until browned. 
4. Pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, until the sauce thickens and the chicken is cooked through. 
5. Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables.

recipes.name: Sushi Rolls
ingredients: Assorted fillings (e.g. avocado, cucumber, crab meat, smoked salmon)
recipes.method:
1. Rinse sushi rice in cold water until the water runs clear. 
2. In a pot, combine rice and water and bring to a boil. 
3. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18-20 minutes. 
4. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, sugar, and salt. 
5. Transfer cooked rice to a large bowl and add the vinegar mixture, stirring gently to combine. 
6. Lay a sheet of nori on a sushi mat or piece of plastic wrap. 
7. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. 
8. Add fillings in a line across the center of the rice. 
9. Roll the sushi tightly, using the mat or plastic wrap to help. 
10. Repeat with remaining nori and fillings. 
11. Slice sushi rolls into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

recipes.name: Mochi Ice Cream
recipes.method:
1. In a bowl, whisk together mochiko, sugar, and water until smooth. 
2. Microwave the mixture for 2-3 minutes, stirring every 30 seconds, until it forms a smooth, sticky dough. 
3. Dust a work surface with cornstarch and roll out the dough to 1/4-inch thickness. 
4. Cut the dough into circles using a cookie cutter or glass. 
5. Place a small scoop of ice cream in the center of each circle and wrap the dough around it, pinching the edges to seal. 
6. Freeze the mochi ice cream for at least 2 hours before serving.

recipes.name: Tonkatsu
recipes.method:
1. Season pork chops with salt and pepper. 
2. Dredge each pork chop in flour, shaking off excess. 
3. Dip in beaten eggs, then coat in panko breadcrumbs. 
4. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 
5. Fry pork chops for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through. 
6. Drain on paper towels. 
7. Serve hot with tonkatsu sauce.

recipes.name: Miso Glazed Eggplant
ingredients: 2 large eggplants, sliced in half lengthwise
recipes.method:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together miso paste, mirin, sake, and sugar. 
3. Brush the cut side of each eggplant half with vegetable oil. 
4. Place eggplant halves cut side down on a baking sheet. 
5. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until tender. 
6. Brush the miso glaze over the eggplant halves and return to the oven. 
7. Bake for another 5-10 minutes, until the glaze is caramelized and bubbly. 
8. Sprinkle with green onions and serve hot.

recipes.name: Green Tea Latte
recipes.method:
1. In a bowl, whisk together matcha powder and hot water until smooth. 
2. In a small pot, heat milk and honey over medium heat until hot but not boiling. 
3. Pour milk mixture into the bowl with matcha and whisk until frothy. 
4. Pour into a mug and serve hot.

recipes.name: Okonomiyaki
recipes.method:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and water until smooth. 
2. Stir in shredded cabbage, green onions, tenkasu, shrimp, and bacon. 
3. Heat a large nonstick pan over medium heat. 
4. Pour the batter into the pan, spreading it out to form a large pancake. 
5. Cook for 5-7 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through. 
6. Drizzle with okonomiyaki sauce and kewpie mayonnaise. 
7. Sprinkle with aonori and katsuobushi. 
8. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Beef Stir-Fry
recipes.method:
1. Cut the beef into thin strips. 
2. Slice the peppers and onion. 
3. In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, ginger powder, salt, and pepper. 
4. In a wok or large skillet, heat some oil over high heat. 
5. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until browned. 
6. Add the garlic and stir-fry for another minute. 
7. Add the peppers and onion and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until tender. 
8. Pour in the soy sauce mixture and stir-fry for another minute until the sauce thickens. 
9. Serve over rice.

recipes.name: Creamy Mushroom Pasta
recipes.method:
1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions. 
2. Slice the mushrooms and mince the garlic. 
3. In a pan, sauté the mushrooms over medium heat until tender. 
4. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. 
5. Pour in the heavy cream and add the thyme, salt, and pepper. 
6. Let simmer until the sauce thickens. 
7. Add the parmesan cheese and stir until melted. 
8. Serve the sauce over the cooked pasta.
